etymologies: late 16th century: probably originally a dialect name for the bilberry, from dialect huckle ‘hip, haunch’ (because of the plant's jointed stems)

definitions: a small, round, edible blue-black berry related to the blueberry.
shortDefinitions: soft edible blue-black fruit resembling currant

definitions: the low-growing North American shrub of the heath family that bears the huckleberry.

notes.text: Genus Gaylussacia, family Ericaceae: several species, including the common black huckleberry (G. baccata)

shortDefinitions: lplant of heather family that bears huckleberry
